sentences.en: As conceit makes one lag behind, so modesty helps one make progress.
sentences.cn: 骄傲使人落后, 谦虚使人进步.

sentences.en: Be modest and prudent, never lag behind!
sentences.cn: 谦虚谨慎, 永不落后!

sentences.en: Be modest, otherwise you will lag behind.
sentences.cn: 要谦虚, 否则就要落后.

sentences.en: Britain is lagging behind the rest of Europe.
sentences.cn: 英国被欧洲其他国家落在了后面。

sentences.en: Britain's economic development must lag behind that of almost every other industrial nation.
sentences.cn: 英国的经济发展肯定落后于几乎所有的其他工业国.

sentences.en: But to many, at least as far as science is concerned, it is the countries that were doing well that are now doing better, whereas those at the bottom continue to lag significantly behind.
sentences.cn: 但是对于许多人而言，至少在科学方面，正是那些在过去做的很好的国家现在正在做的更好，而那些位于底层的国家的科学继续落后。

sentences.en: For more general application the double time lag model should be used.
sentences.cn: 对于更一般的应用,应当采用双肘滞模型.

sentences.en: If you have to take the floorboards up, take the opportunity to lag any pipes at the same time.
sentences.cn: 如果一定要把地板掀开，不妨趁此机会给各个管道加一层隔热保护。

sentences.en: If your payments of rent lag behind, you will be asked to leave.
sentences.cn: 如果你不如期交房租, 你就会被赶走.

sentences.en: In this scenario, due to the lag time required to assimilate new resources, the relationship between required resources and estimated delivery timeframe may even turn negative.
sentences.cn: 在这种情况下，由于时间已经落后，需要吸收新的人力资源，需要的资源和预计的交付时间的关系甚至更加复杂。

sentences.en: Jet lag is caused because the body clock does not readjust immediately to the time change.
sentences.cn: 由于人体生物钟不能迅速对时差作出调整，因而产生了飞机时差反应。

sentences.en: Modesty helps one to go forward [ make progress ]; conceit makes one lag behind.
sentences.cn: 虚心 使人进步, 骄傲使人落后.

sentences.en: One is that some countries still lag behind.
sentences.cn: 一个原因是一些国家仍很落后。

sentences.en: Price rises have matched rises in the money supply with a lag of two or three months.
sentences.cn: 在增加货币供应两三个月后，物价也跟着上涨。

sentences.en: She stopped to wait for Ian who was lagging behind.
sentences.cn: 她停下来等落在后面的伊恩。

sentences.en: Some of the runners in the race began to lag.
sentences.cn: 参加比赛的运动员中有一些开始落后了。

sentences.en: Ten minutes later, some of runners in the race began to lag.
sentences.cn: 十分钟后, 有些参赛的人开始落后了.

sentences.en: That is why we must no longer lag behind.
sentences.cn: 所以我们绝不容许再落后下去.

sentences.en: The thinking of economic bureaucrats tends to lag behind changes in world conditions.
sentences.cn: 经济官员的思想往往跟不上世界局势的变化。

sentences.en: There's a time lag between infection with HIV and developing AIDS.
sentences.cn: 从感染艾滋病病毒到病发有一段滞后期。

sentences.en: We’ve had the hot-water tank lagged.
sentences.cn: 我们已给热水箱加上了保温外罩。

sentences.en: Western banks still lag behind financial institutions in most other regions of the country.
sentences.cn: 西部地区的银行仍然落后于这个国家其他大部分地区的金融机构。

sentences.en: Why does she always lag behind others when we're out for a walk?
sentences.cn: 为什么外出散步时,她总落在后面?

words.tran_cn: 落后；迟延；防护套；囚犯；桶板
落后于；押往监狱；加上外套

phrases.tran_cn: 方头螺钉；板头尖端木螺钉
滞后时间；时滞；时延；迟延时间

trans.tran_en: a delay or period of waiting between one event and a second event
to move or develop more slowly than others
to move or develop more slowly than others

trans.tran_cn: 落后于，给…加上外套，把…关进牢里，逮捕
